revised_title: Inositol Lipids and Transmembrane Signaling: Inositol Phosphates Proliferation, Metabolism, and Function
tldr: This article discusses the complex metabolism of inositol phosphates and their potential functions in animal cells. The authors review the current understanding of inositol phosphate metabolism and propose a coupled mechanism for receptor-stimulated calcium control involving inositol trisphosphate and inositol tetrakisphosphate. They also explore the possibility of inositol phosphates regulating calcium entry and intracellular calcium mobilization.
